Diabetic Banana Bread Recipe

If you're a fan of banana bread but have to watch your sugar intake due to diabetes, we have the perfect recipe for you! This diabetic-friendly banana bread is not only delicious but also low in sugar, making it a guilt-free treat for those with diabetes.

To make this recipe, you'll need the following ingredients:

  • 2 ripe bananas, mashed
  • 1/4 cup unsweetened applesauce
  • 1/4 cup vegetable oil
  • 1/4 cup low-fat milk
  • 2 eggs
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 1/2 cups whole wheat flour
  • 1/2 cup almond flour
  • 1/4 cup granulated sugar substitute
  • 1 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
  • 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • 1/4 cup chopped walnuts (optional)

To start, preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease a loaf pan. In a large bowl, combine the mashed bananas, applesauce, vegetable oil, milk, eggs, and vanilla extract. Mix well until all the ingredients are well combined.

In a separate bowl, whisk together the whole wheat flour, almond flour, sugar substitute, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, stirring until just combined. Be careful not to overmix, as this can result in a dense bread.

If desired, fold in the chopped walnuts for added texture and flavor. Pour the batter into the greased loaf pan and smooth the top with a spatula. Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

Allow the banana bread to cool in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely. Slice and serve as a delicious snack or breakfast option.

This diabetic banana bread is a great way to satisfy your sweet tooth without compromising your health. Enjoy a slice with a cup of tea or coffee, and savor the moist and flavorful goodness guilt-free!
